title: Chief Evangelist
content:
About the Team
Miro’s Product Marketing team is responsible for crafting Miro’s story. We build compelling, insight-led positioning and messaging, develop and deliver impactful go-to-market strategies, and champion customers throughout the product development process. The team partners closely with many functions at Miro, including Product Management, Design, Engineering, Sales, Success, Support, Growth, and Brand.
Successful Product Marketers at Miro think like general managers of their area: flexible but constantly seeking mastery, with strong customer empathy, creative problem-solving ability, research, synthesis, and analytical skills. We regularly shift from high-level strategy to tactical marketing execution, with a bias towards personal accountability and action.
About the Role
The Miro Product Marketing team is seeking a Chief Evangelist to accelerate our mission of empowering teams to build the next big thing. You will showcase Miro’s value through personalized, high-touch experiences with senior decision makers. This role will drive awareness and adoption of our solutions for product and service development leaders, professional service providers and with distributed teams. You will partner closely with Sales, Marketing, and Product to bring insights from the community into Miro and to share your passion for our product and mission with the world. This role will lead a team that oversees product evangelism, our executive briefing experiences and customer advisory boards. You will help further operationalize and scale these programs to increase impact across multiple locations. This is a highly visible role that will engage with our highest priority customers. We’re looking for a strategic and creative leader who has a passion for helping businesses innovate.
What you’ll do

Lead teams who work directly with prospects and customers, delivering compelling executive presentations, product demos, and discussions to drive adoption and expansion of Miro within our top accounts
Establish yourself as a voice of authority in the innovative workspace category, particularly with product development teams 
Flesh out and operationalize the evangelist function
Scale the Miro Discovery Center and Customer Advisory Board programs across multiple locations

What you’ll need

10+years of experience working closely with product development teams, with unique perspective and credibility that can be brought to these audiences 
Comfortable speaking to large audiences, with strong presentation skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills: ability to deliver demos, write compelling blog posts, and communicate content to executive, sales, and technical audiences
Willingness to travel to meet-ups, conferences, and related industry events
Track record of influencing and collaborating with cross-functional teams
Customer orientation and insights-led approach to marketing
A high degree of personal organization and self-management for multiple tasks

What's in it for you

401k matching + Competitive equity package
Excellent Medical, Dental and Vision health benefits
Fertility & Family Forming Benefits
Flexible time off
Lunch, snacks and drinks provided in the office
Wellbeing benefit and WFH equipment allowance
Annual learning and development allowance to grow your skills and career
Up to $2,000 of charitable donation matches each year
About Miro
Miro provides a visual workspace for innovation that enables distributed teams of any size to dream, design, and build the future together. Our mission is to empower teams to create the next big thing by creating a place where teams can create together seamlessly, regardless of location. 
Today, more than 50 million users in 180,000 organizations including Nike, Ikea, Deloitte, WPP, and Cisco depend on Miro to improve product development collaboration, to speed up time to market, and to make sure that new products and services deliver on customer needs.
Miro's visual workspace enables distributed teams to come together to synthesize information, develop strategy, design products and services, and manage processes all throughout the innovation lifecycle. When you look at a Miro Board, you can see hundreds of collaborators moving through the space as named cursors on the screen designing, contributing ideas, providing feedback, and co-creating together with shared tools and information. 
Everyone in Miro has access to the same shared capabilities designed for innovation including diagramming, wireframing, real-time data visualization, and built-in support for agile practices. Miro's workspace is integrated with more than 130 other applications including Jira, Azure DevOps, Asana, Zoom, Slack, and Teams, many of which offer two-way integrations and can be dynamically updated directly from Miro.
Miro enables organizations to accelerate time to market and ensure continuous alignment with customer needs and company strategy. In most organizations, Miro is used by product development teams looking for a new, better way to drive innovation. However, we see more teams including marketing, sales, management consulting, architecture, creative design, and HR that are increasingly applying innovation methodologies such as design thinking and agile practices and adopting Miro for this work.

At Miro, we strive to create and foster an environment of belonging and collaboration across cultural differences. Miro’s mission — Empower teams to create the next big thing — is how we think about our product, people, and culture. We believe that creating big things requires diverse and inclusive teams. Diversity invites all talent with different demography, identities and styles to step in, and inclusion invites them to step closer together. Every day, we are working to build a more diverse Miro, cultivate a sense of belonging for future and current Mironeers around the world, and foster an environment where everyone can collaborate and embrace differences.
